data.enText: the outside or top layer of sth
data.chText: 表面；表层；面

data.enText: an uneven road surface
data.chText: 凹凸不平的路面

data.enText: We'll need a flat surface to play the game on.
data.chText: 我们得有个平面才能玩这个游戏。

data.enText: Teeth have a hard surface layer called enamel.
data.chText: 牙齿有一层叫做釉质的坚硬表层。

data.enText: a broad leaf with a large surface area
data.chText: 表面积很大的阔叶

data.enText: the top layer of an area of water or land
data.chText: 水面；地面；液面

data.enText: the earth's surface
data.chText: 地球表面

data.enText: These plants float on the surface of the water.
data.chText: 这些植物漂浮在水面上。

data.enText: the flat upper part of a piece of furniture, that is used for working on
data.chText: （家具的）顶面，操作台

data.enText: a work surface
data.chText: 操作台

data.enText: She's cleaned all the kitchen surfaces.
data.chText: 她把厨房的所有台面全都收拾干净了。

data.enText: the outer appearance of a person, thing or situation; the qualities that you see or notice, that are not hidden
data.chText: 表面；外表；外观

data.enText: Rage bubbled just below the surface of his mind.
data.chText: 怒火在他心中燃烧，随时可能迸发。

data.enText: on the surface
when not thought about deeply or thoroughly; when not looked at carefully
data.chText: 表面上；从外表看；乍一看

data.enText: It seems like a good idea on the surface but there are sure to be problems.
data.chText: 这主意乍一看不错，但肯定存在问题。

data.enText: On the surface, he appeared unchanged.
data.chText: 看外表他好像没变。

data.enText: scratch the surface (of sth)
to deal with, understand, or find out about only a small part of a subject or problem
data.chText: 作肤浅的探讨；浅尝辄止；隔靴搔痒

data.enText: to come up to the surface of water
data.chText: 升到水面；浮出水面

data.enText: The ducks dived and surfaced again several metres away.
data.chText: 鸭子潜入水中，然后在几米开外钻出水面。

data.enText: to suddenly appear or become obvious after having been hidden for a while
data.chText: （隐藏或被掩盖一段时间后）露面，重新出现，显露，被披露

data.enText: Doubts began to surface.
data.chText: 人们开始怀疑起来。

data.enText: She surfaced again years later in London.
data.chText: 多年后她又出现在伦敦。

data.enText: to wake up or get up after being asleep
data.chText: 醒来；起床

data.enText: He finally surfaced around noon.
data.chText: 他终于在中午时分醒来。

data.enText: to put a surface on a road, path, etc.
data.chText: 铺设路面等

word_means: 露面，重新出现，显露，被披露
simple_means.memory_skill: sur- 次一等的 + face n.脸

means: (隐藏或被掩盖一段时间后)露面，重新出现，显露，被披露
(对高架及地下铁路说的)平地上的

ex.zh: 刮破表面；仅触及问题表面

data.enText: on the surface
when not thought about deeply or thoroughly; when not looked at carefully
data.chText: 表面上；从外表看；乍一看

data.enText: It seems like a good idea on the surface but there are sure to be problems.
data.chText: 这主意乍一看不错，但肯定存在问题。

data.enText: On the surface, he appeared unchanged.
data.chText: 看外表他好像没变。

data.enText: scratch the surface (of sth)
to deal with, understand, or find out about only a small part of a subject or problem
data.chText: 作肤浅的探讨；浅尝辄止；隔靴搔痒

tr: a device that provides reactive force when in motion relative to the surrounding air
can lift or control a plane in flight
the outer boundary of an artifact or a material layer constituting or resembling such a boundary
example: there is a special cleaner for these surfaces
the cloth had a pattern of red dots on a white surface
all the reports were out in the open
the facts had been brought to the surface

tr: a superficial aspect as opposed to the real nature of something
example: it was not what it appeared to be on the surface

tr: the extended two-dimensional outer boundary of a three-dimensional object
example: they skimmed over the surface of the water
a brush small enough to clean every dental surface
the sun has no distinct surface

tr: the outermost level of the land or sea
example: earthquakes originate far below the surface
three quarters of the Earth's surface is covered by water
She turned up at the funeral
I hope the list key is going to surface again

example.ex: Ozone forms a protective layer between 12 and 30 miles above the Earth's surface.
example.tran: 臭氧在地球表面上方 12 到 30 英里处形成一个保护层。

example.ex: ...tiny little waves on the surface of the water...
The road surface has started breaking up...
Its total surface area was seven thousand square feet.
example.tran: 它的总表面积为 7,000 平方英尺。

value.def: The surface of something is the flat top part of it or the outside of it.

example.ex: It can simply be left on the work surface...
example.tran: 把它放在操作台上就行了。

example.ex: Place the fish on a flat surface and sprinkle the flesh with lemon juice and pepper.
example.tran: 将鱼放在案面上并在鱼肉上撒柠檬汁和胡椒粉。

value.def: A work surface is a flat area, for example the top of a table, desk, or kitchen cupboard, on which you can work.

example.ex: Back in Britain, things appear, on the surface, simpler...
example.tran: 而在英国国内，事情表面上看来要简单一些。

example.ex: Social unrest, never far below the surface in Brazil, has erupted over the last few days...
example.tran: 巴西一直以来一触即发的社会不安定因素在过去的几天里爆发了。

example.ex: It's brought to the surface a much wider controversy.
example.tran: 这使得更广泛的争论浮现了出来。

value.def: When you refer to the surface of a situation, you are talking about what can be seen easily rather than what is hidden or not immediately obvious.

example.ex: In contrast with its surface fleet, Britain's submarine force was relatively small.
example.tran: 同其水面舰队相比，英国的潜艇部队规模相对较小。

value.def: Surface is used to describe the parts of the armed forces which travel by ship or by land rather than underwater or in the air.
If someone or something under water surfaces, they come up to the surface of the water.

example.ex: The paper says the evidence, when it surfaces, is certain to cause uproar...
example.tran: 该报称该证据一经披露，一定会引起骚动。

example.ex: The emotions will surface at some point in life...
example.tran: 各种情绪都会在生活中的某个时刻流露出来。

example.ex: The same old problems would surface again.
example.tran: 同样的老问题会再次暴露出来。

value.def: When something such as a piece of news, a feeling, or a problem surfaces, it becomes known or becomes obvious.

example.ex: There's no chance that he'll surface because he's bound to have heard by now...
example.tran: 他不会再出现了，因为他现在肯定听说了。

value.def: When someone surfaces, they appear after not being seen for some time, for example because they have been asleep.
value.tran: (一段时间未见后)现身，露面;醒来

partsOfSpeech.dec: sur- 次一等的 + viv 生命 + -e
sur- 次一等的 + name 名,名字

partsOfSpeech.d: (人机)界面(尤指屏幕布局和菜单)
partsOfSpeech.dec: inter- 在…之间,相互 + face n.脸
